quests.title: Getting Started
quests.text: Welcome to Craft to Exile! This progression log aims to provide you with some direction as to where to go next. For starters, it's recommended that you do some light exploring in the Overworld just as you would normally, and to set up camp. Please make sure to redeem your rewards as you progress!

quests.title: The Crux
quests.text: You may have noticed the bag in your inventory - right click to use it. In Craft to Exile, gear is mainly acquired by killing mobs. Crafted equipment can be used, but the power will be limited. Dropped equipment scales with the mob level, so the stronger the mobs the better the gear! Try to kill some zombies - hopefully you'll find a new piece of gear.

quests.title: Getting Stronger
quests.text: As you fight mobs and complete quests, you will earn experience. Once enough experience is gained you will level up and become stronger. Upon leveling, you will earn stat points, skill points, and talent points. Press H to access the Mine and Slash hub to distribute your points, and customize your character accordingly! Do not worry about messing up your stats as reset potions are available later in the game.

quests.title: The Bumblezone
quests.text: Craft to Exile has a loose progression system. While you could stay in the Overworld until level 40, The Bumblezone is a recommended zone for level 10-25. The recommended levels for each dimension are as follows: Overworld (1-40), The Bumblezone (11-25), Nether (20-35), The End (35-40), Good Night's Sleep (40-65), Midnight (60-75), Maps (40-99). To get to the Bumblezone, throw an Enderpearl at any Bee Nest or Beehive. You can leave the Bumblezone by digging down or climbing above Y = 256.

quests.title: Ores
quests.text: In Craft to Exile, special ores spawn in the overworld. These important ores have different rarities and can be used to repair gear or craft special items. Check JEI for more information.

quests.title: Currency Items
quests.text: Currency items are powerful items with the ability to reroll the stats on your gear. In order to use them, you must craft a modify station.

quests.title: Broken Swords
quests.text: With the use of a repair station, you can repair equipment using ores. Additionally, capacitors can be attached to repair stations to improve ore repair efficiency. Note: common ores are VERY inefficient, you should use at least uncommon ores.

quests.title: Upgrading Your Gear
quests.text: With a modify station, you are able to upgrade or reroll your gear using currency dropped by mobs. Craft one soon!

quests.title: TOO. MUCH. LOOT.
quests.text: Are you having issues with hoarding loot? Look no further! You can craft a salvage station to turn unused gear into ores! Note: this will not work with crafted gear.

quests.title: Still Too Much...
quests.text: You can craft currency and gear bags that will automagically pick up currency and gear for you, while providing additional storage while adventuring. Check the JEI for the crafting recipe!

quests.title: Bzzzy Beez
quests.text: Welcome to The Bumblezone! Here you'll find a plethora of biomes filled with honey, bees, and more! Explore The Bumblezone and return with all the sweets! But beware, taking honey from bees may involve risks...

quests.title: Stop The Buzz
quests.text: You're probably getting real annoyed by the bees... So let's get rid of some!

quests.title: Stop The Buzz 2
quests.text: There are so many different bee types here... Exterminate!

quests.title: Feeling Sweet
quests.text: Sugar water is Bumblezone-specific and can be stored in a bottle. Drinking sugar water will restore a small amount of hunger and increase your movement speed.

quests.title: Bittersweet
quests.text: And thus, our journey in the hive comes to an end. But the bee's legacy may last forever. Honey slimes are special slimes that can generate honey similar to how a sheep produces wool. Provide enough honey, and I'll turn it into honey slimes for you. Note: redeem this quest in a fenced off area if you would like to farm the honey slimes! Hint: you can find altars of assorted honeycomb in caves in The Bumblezone.

quests.title: The Nether Regions
quests.text: At level 20, you'll be able to take on the Nether. Craft an obsidian portal to access the Nether - you'll be able to take the same portal back to the Overworld. Enter the Nether and stop the Demon Lords from invading the Overworld!

quests.title: Stay Safe
quests.text: The Nether is a lava-filled zombie pig-infested area. Be careful not to dig straight down.

quests.title: All Your Bases
quests.text: Craft to Exile includes the fantastic MineColonies mod which will allow you to establish a home 'base'. In a MineColony, you will act as the leader and oversee production of new facilities and ensure that citizens are happy. Get started by crafting the building tool. From this point on, you will build your buildings by right-clicking with the tool. The wand will auto-detect any building blocks you have in your inventory.

quests.title: My Tent
quests.text: The supply camp is the first thing you need to a successful establishment. Although not functionally useful, the supply camp is required since it will provide you with a town hall. It is important to choose your first location for your town hall wisely. You will need a large flat area for your entire colony (the town hall must also be on flat ground). You will notice that right-clicking with the supply camp allows you to visualize where you can put your supply camp.

quests.title: Work Work
quests.text: Finally, some citizens from the town hall! To start building buildings, you will need to establish a builder's hut. Place the builder's hut with your wand and immediately, one of your citizens will become a builder. Make sure to feed your citizens well! Explore the building options on JEI, or visit the MineColonies wiki for more information.

quests.title: End Game
quests.text: Congratulations. You're in the end game now! The max level is 99. Good luck!

quests.title: Oooh Shiny
quests.text: A villager in town is really addicted to unique ores and materials. Help them out by finding 50 quartz!

quests.title: Glowing Skin
quests.text: Now that you've given them quartz, they know you're capable of traversing the Nether! They've asked you to go back and bring them 30 glowstone blocks!

quests.title: Warts
quests.text: After sleeping with the glowstone and licking quartz, the poor villager has come out with a terrible case of warts. They've heard that nether wart can be a quick-fix cure and have asked you to bring them some nether wart!

quests.title: Aquaculture
quests.text: Aquaculture is a fantastic mod that enhances the vanilla fishing experience. Follow this questline to see what Aquaculture has to offer!

quests.title: So Long...
quests.text: Craft yourself a tackle box if you want to be a true fisherman. A tacklebox will allow you to customize your fishing outfit and hold onto various fishing items!

quests.title: Hooker
quests.text: Hooks can enhance your fishing rod with various effects. Iron hooks will increase your fishing rod durability. Try out other hooks to see their benefits!

quests.title: Rodular Upgrade
quests.text: Higher tier fishing rods will increase your chances at catching better fish and have increased durability!

quests.title: For All The Fish
quests.text: Neptunium is an ore specific to Aquaculture. You can craft really powerful fishing rods and accessories with neptunium.

quests.title: What The Blaze?
quests.text: The Nether has a plethora of enemies to encounter and many unique biomes. Hopefully, when you come across blazes you won't be so scorched.

quests.title: Who Cut Cheese?
quests.text: The Nether is an unforgiving realm. You're likely to shed tears from frustration. But did you know monsters in the Nether can cry too?

quests.title: Withering Away
quests.text: As you traverse the Nether, darkness starts to gnaw at your psyche. Quickly, we must get out of here! Kill the withers and grab their skulls. Only then can we leave...

quests.title: Black Death
quests.text: Finally, assemble 4 blocks of soul sand/soil in a T shape and THEN place the 3 wither skeleton heads on top, and kill the Wither! But be warned, it won't be easy!

quests.title: Light In The Shadows
quests.text: Remember that villager? Yeah, they're back... Seems like warts weren't enough to get them off shiny objects. This time they're asking for nether stars... THREE of them!

quests.title: The End
quests.text: With an Eye of Ender, you can locate a stronghold in the Overworld that will let you access The End. Be sure to bring 12 Eye of Enders with you to activate the portal. Get ready... The End is near.

quests.title: End Of An Era
quests.text: You made it! You're at The End! Woo- *GRUMBLE GRUMBLE* what the?! Is that a dragon I hear?

quests.title: The Ender Dragon
quests.text: Kill the Ender Dragon.

quests.title: End Remnants
quests.text: With the Ender Dragon gone, you should revisit The End and explore the islands that are left. Maybe you'll find a special chest or something along the way...

quests.title: Back To The Nether
quests.text: After returning to the village, you heard rumours about villagers constantly having nightmares. According to a bar keeper, villagers have resorted to consuming mushrooms which seemed to have a 50% success rate at deterring the nightmares. Find the mushrooms in the Nether and see what you can do about the nightmares.

quests.title: Time To Sleep
quests.text: You've learned that it's possible to access the so-called nightmare realm by forcefully sleeping on a bed imbued with the power of the mushrooms. Try it for yourself and see if you can solve the nightmare mystery.

quests.title: Blissful Awakening
quests.text: Lucky you! You've accessed the Good Dream dimension, where you'll find unicorns and rainbows. You sense that something is wrong with the balance of positive and negative energy. If you'd like, use positite or negatite gems to craft a luxurious or wretched bed to access the respective dimension directly. You will automagically leave the dream dimensions after 20 minutes.

quests.title: Sleep Paralysis
quests.text: How unfortunate. You've accessed the Nightmare dimension, where you'll find demons and darkness. You sense that something is wrong with the balance of positive and negative energy. If you'd like, use positite or negatite gems to craft a luxurious or wretched bed to access the respective dimension directly. You will automagically leave the dream dimensions after 20 minutes.

quests.title: Point The Way
quests.text: Waystones is a mod that allows the player to teleport between waystones using warp stones or scrolls. They can be found naturally spawning around the world in large towers. It is possible to rename or configure the waystone into a global waystone. Global waystones can be teleported to interdimensionally. The warp stone allows you to teleport to any waystone at a cost. It has a longer cooldown than using scrolls.

quests.title: Show Me The Way
quests.text: Scrolls are a fast way of teleporting to a waystone. They are one-time use, but cheaper and faster than warp stones.

quests.title: Direct Me The Whey
quests.text: Warp scrolls are consumables that let you teleport to a waypoint. You could also use a warp stone, but warp stones have long cooldowns and are more costly to use.

quests.title: Hit Them Where It Stings
quests.text: These brood zones seem to be where the bees are being produced. Destroy the blocks and harvest the honey for yourself.

quests.title: Slimey Means
quests.text: Honey slimes are a great 100% honey. Kill them and harvest the honey!

quests.title: Where Are The Minutemen?!
quests.text: Occasionally, your colony will be faced with barbarian and pirate raids. You'll need to set up a guard troop to protect your citizens, but until then, you'll need to defend them yourself!

quests.title: Exploring Fiery Depths
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Squashing Bugs
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Burning Hides
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Heebie Jeebies
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Firebolt!
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: And The Brain
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Finding The Source
quests.text: Interrogate the hellish minions by force to find out where the Demons Lords Reside!

quests.title: Lords Of The Underworld
quests.text: Asmodeus and Rahovart serve the Wither. Find Asmodeus and Rahovart in the Nether and eliminate them.

quests.title: On The Hunt
quests.text: The Endermen are hindering your ability to safely traverse The End. Clear out the remaining Endermen in The End.

quests.title: Squashing Bugs II
quests.text: It seems that The End and the Nether have some sort of connection. However, these trites seem to have undergone some sort of void transformation.

quests.title: What Are These Anyway?
quests.text: These morbid undead beings feed on dead energy. Due to the unstable energy they possess, they explode upon death. Be careful!

quests.title: And The Brain II
quests.text: Kill these creatures in The End to prevent some from leaving the void and into the Overworld.

quests.title: Firing That Lazer
quests.text: Kill these creatures in The End to prevent some from leaving the void and into the Overworld.

quests.title: Make Your Bed
quests.text: Making a luxurious bed using your positite gem will allow you to freely access the Good Dream dimension without worrying about having a nightmare.

quests.title: In A Daze
quests.text: It's very peaceful in this dream world. It's to try to find clues first. Try harvesting natural materials to analyse their components.

quests.title: Unicorns...
quests.text: Perhaps killing the most pure creature will provide hints...

quests.title: Candyland
quests.text: Sweet ore? Maybe it's connected to the nightares... Definitely. Mine some and smelt them into candy to find out... for science.

quests.title: ... And Rainbows!
quests.text: This multi-coloured ore has red in it! It has red in it! Must be evil.

quests.title: Staying Positive
quests.text: Positite gems radiate with positive energy. Perhaps collecting a few of these will help us understand how to restore balance.

quests.title: Sweet Tooth
quests.text: Since we're here, let's harvest some of the natural sweet foods of the realm... Starting with lolipops! Harvest lolipops from the lolipop bushes.

quests.title: Seeds To Happiness
quests.text: Harvest some rainbow seeds by breaking the grass. You can plant these seeds to harvest rainbow berries!

quests.title: The Full Arch
quests.text: Rainbow berries are delicious, filling, and pretty to look at. That's really it though!

quests.title: Make Your Bed II
quests.text: Making a wretched bed using your negatite gem will allow you to freely access the Nightmare dimension.

quests.title: In A Haze
quests.text: Find your bearings in this nightmare realm. Find and harvest planks native to this area to find out more about how the Nightmare dimensions works.

quests.title: The Source Of The Undead
quests.text: After analysing the various wooden planks, you find out that they're imbued with undead energy. Find the source of the undead energy in the underground.

quests.title: Zits Are Evil
quests.text: Ever since arriving in the Nightmare realm, you notice your acne has gotten worse. Zitrite is believed to be increase 'acne-causing' radiation levels. Get rid of it!

quests.title: Negative Karma
quests.text: You sense a great disturbance in the balance of positive and negative energies. Harvest negatite gems - maybe you can do something with the positite and negatite gems.

quests.title: Source Of Negativity
quests.text: Lobbers are firing balls of negative energy. Exterminate them! Watch for the flames!

quests.title: Unpleasantries
quests.text: Spectres freely roam between dimensions and wreak havoc on the psyche of any living organism. Wherever they go, they bring with them misfortune. Find them and destroy them.

quests.title: Dream Eaters
quests.text: Reapers feed on the spiritual energy of the dead. However, they may mistaken a sleeping being as a dead one, and will attempt to harvest their energy in their sleep. Reapers come from The Midnight dimension - accessible only once someone has seen death. Find some reapers and kill them; absorb their energy and find out how to access The Midnight

quests.title: Eternal Darkness
quests.text: The Midnight is an endgame dimension that is difficult to access, and survive. Find a large heap of malignant red plant blocks - these will spawn a portal that allows you access The Midnight. However, the portal will only spawn at night. Once you enter The Midnight, you cannot leave until it is night in the Overworld - rifts will start to open in The Midnight which will teleport you back to the Overworld.

quests.title: Optimization Algorithms
quests.text: Putting capacitors into repair stations is a great way to be more efficient with your ores. Did you know better capacitors are even more efficient?

quests.title: The Master Bag
quests.text: Combining the three bag types will produce the master bag!

quests.title: Beastiary I
quests.text: Zoataur is a creature in the Overworld that spreads plague and disaster. It comes from the darkest depths of the void...

quests.title: Beastiary II
quests.text: The Cockatrice is a powerful flying creature that has found its way from the Overworld into The Bumblezone. It has been terrorizing the local bee populace and needs to be stopped!

quests.title: Beastiary III
quests.text: This powerful and ancient dragon can be found in the Nether. The ignibus draws power from lava, and as a result, can be found residing in lava.

quests.title: Beastiary IV
quests.text: The remobra is a creature from the void that is hard to detect. Opportunistic creatures, they will strike when you least expect it. Travel to The End to find the remobra.

quests.title: Beastiary V
quests.text: The uvaraptor is a creature that was able to slip into the Good Dream realm during a rift event. Although the uvaraptor's wings glisten like a rainbow, the creature originally came from The Midnight. Be careful when hunting these beautiful creatures.

quests.title: Beastiary VI
quests.text: A grotesque beast that can only be found in The Midnight. The power this creature possesses is unfathomable.

quests.title: What's The Date?
quests.text: Craft to Exile offers seasons to add more complexity to farming. With Serene Seasons, Simple Farming, and Cooking for Blockheads, the farming and cooking experience is more complex and enjoyable. To start off, it's a good idea to craft a calendar, which will tell you what the current season is. By doing so, you can plant the appropriate seeds.

quests.title: Milkin' It
quests.text: Milk is an essential ingredient to most cooking recipes, including cheese. Milk a cow using a bucket. Did you know that eating unique foods will permanently increase your health? Get to cookin' (use'/foodlist size' to see how many foods you've eaten)!

quests.title: Gouda Job!
quests.text: Cheese is used in a lot of recipes in Simple Farming. But you'll notice that there is no way to craft a cheese slice. That's because to get a cheese slice, you must place a wheel of cheese down and click it (similar to cake).

quests.title: A Recipe For Disaster
quests.text: You're probably feeling overwhelmed by all the possible foods you can make. Don't worry! You can just farm and worry about cooking later with the recipe book 'Cooking for Blockheads I'! By using the book, you can see which foods you can make with the things you have in your inventory.

quests.title: Food Storage
quests.text: With all the foods you have, you might need to look for a storage solution. Luckily, Cooking for Blockheads allows you to build a fully functional kitchen (did you know the sink provides infinite water!?).

quests.title: Upgrading Your Kitchen
quests.text: It was mentioned before that you can upgrade your kitchen, so we're going to do exactly that. The oven enables smelting abilities in your kitchen - try it out!

quests.title: The Possibilities!
quests.text: While 'Cooking for Blockheads I' can be mighty useful, sometimes you just want to see all the available recipes (and without scouring JEI). You can make an unfiltered recipe book to look at available foods to cook!

quests.title: Back To The Chopping Board
quests.text: The cooking table functions similar to the oven, but provides your kitchen with crafting abilities.

quests.title: I Can't Carry Anymore
quests.text: Sometimes you just want the good old fashioned travel storage solution.

quests.title: Your Engineering Degree
quests.text: Immersive Engineering is a tech mod that is included with Craft to Exile. Unfortunately the scope of the mod is very broad and it's unlikely that progression will be implemented for IE. However, IE happens to have a great engineer's manual which will provide you with all the information you need!

quests.title: Rift Seeker
quests.text: Rifters are prominent in The Midnight. Perhaps killing them will give you a clue as to how to get back.

quests.title: Richard Rider
quests.text: The nova is a creature that can be easily mistaken for ores. What even makes them float?

quests.title: This Ain't The Bumblezone
quests.text: These tiny scorpion-looking things have enough venom in their stingers to kill you in 10 seconds... If you don't do anything.

quests.title: From The Shadows
quests.text: Don't be deceived by the adorable look these creatures can give you. They say skulks bring more misfortune to those they cross than black cats. Be warned, skulks have the ability to blend with their surroundings.

quests.title: Stick To The Basics
quests.text: You sense power emanating from everything - even the trees. Fetch some sticks and maybe the source of power can be analyzed.

quests.title: Obsidian?
quests.text: Nightstone is native to The Midnight. Rumours have it that if you stare into nightstone for too long, you'll succumb to eternal darkness.

quests.title: Bad Kind Of Shroom
quests.text: Rock on! These shrooms look radical... Let's bring some back for SCIENCE.

quests.title: Midnight Rifts
quests.text: Ebonite ore literally stands for black ore. It's even darker than nightstone, so it's probably a good idea to grab what we need and leave.

quests.title: Pitch Black
quests.text: Nagrilite possesses a unique characteristic: it's dark and shiny!

quests.title: Tenebrum
quests.text: Tenebrum: darkness. Once forged, the darkness in this metal aborbs light, making it impervious to holy attacks.

quests.title: Mapping Device
quests.text: The mapping device opens portals to a dungeon realm. In this realm, you are unable to place or break blocks... So tread carefully. Always bring teleportation scrolls with you in case you get stuck! To use the mapping device, place it in an flat and open space. Fill it up with ores (fuel), then take the map in your hand and use it on the mapping device. Good luck!

quests.title: The Grand Hempening
quests.text: Hemp is vital to starting Immersive Engineering. You can craft hemp seeds using wheat and a gold ingot.

quests.title: Crafting Equipment
quests.text: In Craft to Exile, it is possible to craft equipment. Feel free to craft equipment if you're in a bind. Crafted equipment follow a progression system as well. In general, equipment from stronger dimensions are for higher levels. For more information please visit the wiki.

quests.title: Shield Hero
quests.text: In Craft to Exile, you can craft shields if you need an offhand item in a pinch. Crafted shields follow a loose pipleline: shield -> honey crystal shield -> heavy plated shield -> rockshroom shield.

quests.title: Sweet Retribution
quests.text: The honey crystal shield is unique to The Bumblezone and should suffice up until level 40 (you'll need to craft a new one every few levels)!

quests.title: Caves
quests.text: The Caves are an endless cave that can be accessed by crafting a portal out of mossy stone and using an emerald on it (similar to the Nether portal and flint and steel). It's recommended that you're at least level 35 before entering the Caves.

quests.title: Caves II
quests.text: The Caves II are a larger endless cave that can be accessed by crafting a portal out of mossy stone and using a diamond on it (similar to the Nether portal and flint and steel). It's recommended that you're at least level 80 before entering the Caves II.

quests.title: Storage Solutions
quests.text: Storage Drawers is a mod that makes sorting your loot a lot easier! Use storage drawers to label and autosort your items, and more! Visit the wiki to see the full capabilities of Storage Drawers!

quests.title: Shared Experience
quests.text: If you're having problems teleporting back to your body then I have the solution for you! XP blocks are craftable blocks that can store experience. They can even be shared with other players!

quests.title: Sleeping On The Job
quests.text: Can't deal with mobs at night while travelling? Tired of lugging an entire bed frame? Craft the sleeping bag and sleep whenever, wherever! Some conditions may apply.
